question_sentence: Who took office as the first female president of the International Olympic Committee?
evidence: The former competitive swimmer from Zimbabwe made history as the first woman and first African to become president of the International Olympic Committee when she was elected in March. She officially assumed the role this week at a handover ceremony in Lausanne, and must now tackle myriad challenges facing the organisation.

question_sentence: Which self-driving car company has opened a huge new factory to build its fleet of robotaxis?
evidence: Amazon has owned Zoox since 2020, but the new 220,000 sq ft manufacturing facility in Hayward, California, signals its intention to position Zoox as a serious challenger to Google's fleet of Waymo robotaxis. The plant will eventually be capable of producing three autonomous vehicles an hour, equivalent to 10,000 a year.

question_sentence: Nato leaders met in which Dutch city to formalise a new agreement on defence spending?
evidence: The run-up to the Nato summit was mired in uncertainty after Donald Trump appeared to distance himself from the agreed target of 5% of GDP towards military spending. However, speaking alongside Nato secretary general Mark Rutte in The Hague, Trump said the US would commit to the target "all the way".

question_sentence: Which US state announced plans to build a nuclear power plant, its first since 1989?
evidence: Governor Kathy Hochul has ordered the state's public energy utility to build New York's first new nuclear power plant in close to four decades. The plant will be constructed in upstate New York and will generate at least one gigawatt of energy, enough to power a million homes.

question_sentence: Which member of U2 finally became an Irish citizen?
evidence: U2's lead guitarist and keyboardist, real name David Howell Evans, was born to Welsh parents in Essex, but grew up in Dublin. Despite forming part of one of Ireland's most successful music acts of all time, he only recently applied for citizenship – and on Monday, he joined other new citizens to take the loyalty oath at a ceremony in Killarney, County Kerry.

question_sentence: The successful launch of the Axiom-4 mission made Shubhanshu Shukla the first Indian to do what?
evidence: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla launched into space on Wednesday morning aboard the Axiom-4 mission from Kennedy Space Center. He is the first Indian astronaut go into space in 41 years, and the first to visit Nasa's orbiting laboratory.

question_sentence: According to a recent poll, what percentage of Britons see the US as a "friend and ally"?
evidence: The YouGov poll of 1,788 British adults shows a precipitous decline in trust even since December, when 42% of respondents said they viewed the US as a friend and ally. The latest figure represents the lowest trust in the US since YouGov began asking the question in 2019.

question_sentence: Scientists have created healthy mice with two what?
evidence: A team led by Yanchang Wei at Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China, used epigenome editing to create healthy mice from two sperm cells and an empty egg. The findings, published in PNAS, could pave the way to a future in which two men may be able to have a genetically related child.

question_sentence: Cristiano Ronaldo has signed a new two-year deal to remain with which Saudi football club?
evidence: There had been widespread speculation that Ronaldo might leave the Saudi Pro League side when his contract expired at the end of this month, but the new deal will see him stay until at least 2027, when he will be 42 years old. The Portuguese star has scored 99 goals for Al Nassr since his debut in December 2022 and ended last season as the league's top scorer.

question_sentence: Students in the UK and Ireland will spend how many years of their life on their phone, according to a new study?
evidence: A five-month study by productivity app Fluid Focus found that the average student at school or university could spend up to 25 years of their life on their smartphone, with some heavy users potentially logging up to 41 years of screen time by spending nine hours a day on their phone.

question_sentence: President Trump announced numerous appointments to an advisory council inside the Department of Homeland Security this week. Which member of his inner circle was not selected?
choices: Chris Cox, a chainsaw artist and founder of Bikers for Trump
evidence: Ivanka Trump will not sit on the council, which will provide “real-time, real-world and independent advice on homeland security operations.”

question_sentence: A panel of three federal appellate judges ruled that which state’s law requiring the Ten Commandments to be posted in public school classrooms was unconstitutional?
evidence: The ruling marked a major win for civil liberties groups who say the Louisiana mandate violates the separation of church and state.

question_sentence: Which supermarket chain announced plans this week to close 60 stores?
evidence: Kroger is set to close about 5% of its grocery stores over the next year and a half.

question_sentence: Which team won the NBA championship this week?
evidence: The Thunder defeated the Indiana Pacers 103-91 and won their first NBA title since moving from Seattle to Oklahoma.

question_sentence: Residents in Santa Monica, California, are upset with Waymo and its robotaxis for which of the following reasons?
choices: They keep crashing into parked cars
evidence: Residents say the horns, backup beeps and flashing lights on Waymo’s robotaxis keep them awake at night.

question_sentence: Zohran Mamdani declared victory in New York City’s Democratic primary for mayor. Which of the following policy ideas is not part of his platform?
choices: Free child care for working parents
evidence: Mamdani, a 33-year-old democratic socialist, wants to freeze rent increases, raise taxes on the wealthy and make city buses free to ride.

question_sentence: Which dating app is laying off hundreds of workers?
evidence: Bumble, whose stock has lost 90% of its value since going public in 2021, is axing 30% of its workforce.

question_sentence: Which country won the most honors at the Decanter World Wine Awards 2025?
evidence: France took home 3,200 medals in total (1,000 more than its closest competitor) and 14 Best in Shows.

question_sentence: A former jewelry store manager in the UK was sentenced to prison for stealing more than $170,000 in diamonds, gold, silver, “bespoke jewelry” and cash from her employer. How was she caught?
choices: Security cameras hidden in the store’s light fixtures
She dropped a bag filled with the loot on the street
She took pictures of herself wearing the stolen merchandise
evidence: Lucy Roberts sent her former coworkers selfies from a cruise, decked out in items stolen from the shop.

question_sentence: Beyoncé closed out the international portion of her Cowboy Carter tour with which special guest?
evidence: Jay-Z joined his wife onstage in Paris to perform three songs.
